info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 10:19PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Pondera, east central Glacier, southwestern Toole and northeastern Teton Counties through 1100 PM MDT... At 1018 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Cut Bank to near Valier. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Conrad, Valier, Brady and Ledger. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 329 and 364. Highway 2 between mile markers 272 and 279. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
